newsitem.title: USA: Recount likely in Florida congressional race.
newsitem.headline: Recount likely in Florida congressional race.

text.p: Former Tampa, Fla., Mayor Sandy Freedman won a spot in the runoff election for the Democratic nomination in the 11th Congressional District but elections officials said Wednesday a recount probably would be required to determine who her opponent will be.

With 100 percent of the precincts counted, unofficial results showed state Rep. Jim Davis was the apparent second-place winner with a 71-vote lead over Hillsborough County Commissioner Phyllis Busansky.
Freedman finished first with 23,501 votes, followed by Davis with 16,750, Busansky with 16,479 and former state Sen. Pat Frank with 10,578 votes.

Because no one won more than 50 percent of the votes, the top two contenders will face each other in a runoff election Oct 1. The winner will face Republican Mark Sharpe in the November general election to succeed U.S. Rep. Sam Gibbons, D-Tampa.
The board of elections supervisors planned to meet Wednesday afternoon to release official results and determine if a recount would be required.
